Package com.message.security

Class Decrypt

java.lang.Object
com.message.security.Decrypt
public final class Decrypt extends Object
The Decrypt class contains several useful class fields and methods. It can be instantiated in two ways. The facility provided by the Decrypt class is decrypt a String with a keypair which is encrypted by the Encrypt class from com.message.security package. It uses another class Utility for basic decrypting operations. All the class fields and methods are either private or protected except the constructor and decrypt method.

If an String, encrypted with Default keypair, is to be decrypted, use the following constructor: 
     Decrypt d = new Decrypt(encrypt_object);
This will automatically detect the keypair and decrypt the message. But if an String with User defined keypair is to be decrypted, use the following constructor: 
     Decrypt d = new Decrypt(key1, key2);
Where key1 and key2 are the user defined key which were used to encrypt the String. The object will not be able to decrypt the String if keypair do not match. It cannot detect the User-defined keypair.
Author:
tinykishore
See Also:
Utility, Encrypt

  • Constructor Details

    • Decrypt

      public Decrypt​(Encrypt e)
      Internal constructor for decrypting Default keypair encryption. This will assign the decrypting objects keypair with the encrypting object's keypair.
      Parameters:
      e - object of Encrypt class which was used to encrypt the String.

    • Decrypt

      public Decrypt​(int userKeyOne, int userKeyTwo) throws KeyPairNumberOutOfBounds
      Internal constructor for decrypting User-defined keypair encryption. This constructor will take two integer parameter which is the keypair. Using that keypair, the decrypt object will decrypt a String.
      Parameters:
      userKeyOne - Key 1
      userKeyTwo - Key 2
      Throws:
      KeyPairNumberOutOfBounds - When Exceed Range

  • Method Details

    • getKeyOne

      protected int getKeyOne()
      This getter-method returns the current object's key-1.
      Returns:
      First factor for decryption

    • getKeyTwo

      protected int getKeyTwo()
      This getter-method returns the current object's key-2.
      Returns:
      Second factor for decryption

    • toKeyString

      @Deprecated protected String toKeyString()
      Deprecated.
      Returns the Keypair of current decrypt object as a String. This method is deprecated due to security reasons and no longer needed.
      Returns:
      Keypair as a String

    • decrypt

      public String decrypt​(String message)
      This method is for decrypting a String. Calls decryptSystem(String) for decrypting.
      Parameters:
      message - The String that is to be decrypted
      Returns:
      Decrypted message.
